resources.string: Anurag Android Club (AAC) was initiated with the motto of developing mobile applications on Android technology for the common people needs in daily life.

Our main objective is to introduce students to real world problems and usecases in the field of InfoSec.Following our club’s motto, in today’s world of growing cyber crime, we train young minds to be acutely aware of the world of information security and also emergent technologies like BlockChain to contribute in building a Cyber Secure India.

The Data Analytics Club’s (DAC) mission is to focus on career development and equip students with the right skills and tools that will enable them to develop/apply relevant analytics-driven solutions. In pursuit of this goal, we will provide hands-on experience in business analytics through, learning, events, program simulations, and guest lectures.

The Internet Of Things Club is a place where you can find the latest information around The Internet Of Things. From news, ideas where the IOT can take us, to examples from everyday applications. We are like the Internet Of Things, a Club open to everyone and everything.

We, The club of Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence enrich the students who are fond of learning how M.L. and A.I. make the world a better place.Students will have contact with the Industry level people delegates who give insight about what is happening in the current software trends and how they progress making the student learn up-to date technologies with regard to A.I. and M.L.

The Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) is a U.S.-based international learned society for computing. It was founded in 1947 and is the world’s largest and most prestigious scientific and educational computing society.Its motto is "Advancing Computing as a Science and Profession.

Anurag IEEE student branch Inaugurated on 28th July 2012 by Dr Atul Negi, Professor, Department of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Hyderabad and Chair, IEEE, Hyderabad section.IEEE Student Chapter provides an oppurtunity for its student members to begin networking in their area of interest and future profession.

AGI Indian Society for technical Education (ISTE) student chapter was established in 2012 at Anurag Group of Institutions with an aim to improve the students’ overall personality in line with the nation’s technical education system. AGI ISTE student chapter being a vibrant student chapter, has 1208 students as its members till date.
